325933771530.title: HDMI To VGA / D-SUB Universal Display Adapter - Perfect for use with CRTs
325933771530.description:
These are fantastic devices that will convert a digital signal (HDMI) into an analog VGA signal over D-SUB. This is really useful if you have an old flat panel or CRT that only has VGA input and your computer has HDMI output only. The quality of the output is very good.


HP P/N 700568-001, but these are not HP specific.


I have multiple - so let me know if you want more than one. Dispatched same day.

326344652367.description:
Comprehensively tested and externally cleaned.


All the optical drives I sell go through thorough testing to ensure they are working correctly. The drive pictured is exactly what you will receive. 


  • Eject mechanism tested and working

  • Drive is physically cleaned - no dust

  • Specialist tests carried out to ensure correct operation, including transfer speeds and access times.

  • Happy to include a cable if needed


Dispatched same day. Please note that any specifications provided are a guide - it’s always worth checking the model number against the manufacturer’s website if you have very specific needs.


--


“Used” means tested and working and only sold if I would be happy using it myself. You will never find swollen capacitors, dry thermal paste, dead CMOS batteries or temporary reflow fixes. My high feedback and exceptionally low return rate speaks for itself. 


Returns are applicable under eBay’s terms if the item is not as described or not functioning, so you can buy with confidence! 


I’m here to help - so feel free to contact me for pre-sales advice and guidance. Many people want a machine for playing a specific retro game - I regularly do custom orders so you know what you are buying will work perfectly for you.


All photography is my own and screenshots are taken during the testing process, so you will get exactly what is seen (unless stated otherwise).


If you need cables (for example IDE, SATA), I am usually happy to include them free of charge - just leave a note during purchase.


If you need drivers, please contact me in advance. Sometimes I can provide them, sometimes I can’t.


I package things carefully, with sensitive components in anti-static bags and guarantee same day dispatch if ordered before ~2pm on weekdays, and more often than not outside of that time frame too. I’m always happy to combine shipping.

326696798859.title: Wyse S50 Sx0 902114-32L Thin Client AMD Geode 366MHz 64MB/128MB Complete Kit NEW
326696798859.description:
New and sealed Wyse S50 thin client in original packaging with complete kit.

The one in photography is one that I opened to play with - the ones I'm selling are sealed. They happily boot from USB, but I found it problematic trying to get it to boot from the internal IDE flash disk with Windows. I also bought some adapters for the IDE interface to Compact Flash but they don't quite fit - you can get them in just about, but you won't get the top back on! But I bought a few, so you're welcome to one if you want it included (although I'll have to open the box to put it in before shipping).

There is a PS/2 mouse included in the box, however, there are no PS/2 ports on the device - I think they would have likely plugged into a keyboard that plugged into it or something. If you don't need it, let me know and I'll keep it as I'll definitely find a use!

These are pretty nifty bits of kit though, I think ideal for running Linux or Windows XP on.

Complete kit includes:
• Wyse S50 thin client unit (902114-32L)
• 12V power adapter
• Wyse mouse
• Connection cables
• Quick start guide documentation

Technical Specifications:
• AMD Geode GX processor @ 366MHz
• 64MB Flash memory / 128MB DDR RAM
• 10/100 Fast Ethernet network connection
• 4x USB 2.0 ports (2 front, 2 rear)
• VGA display output (up to 1600x1200)
• Audio in/out connections
• Serial port (RS232)
• Wyse Linux operating system
• Dimensions: 177 x 121 x 34mm
• Weight: 2.7kg

326594439460.title: Coleco Games Clay To Win 1988 *COMPLETE*
326594439460.description:
Overall this is in good condition. The cards look like new. The putty has clearly been replaced with some more modern play-dough, which works well at the moment but "well" is quite subjective when it comes to play-dough and it's basically a consumable item. I would rather you buy thinking "I'll replace it" and then be surprised when it's fine than the other way around.

The box lid is not completely flat - it's sunken in a little around one of the parts and it was *super* hard to get it to show on the photography. All inline with the general wear and tear you would expect from such an old item!

326415597860.title: Pine Crystal CS4281 PCI Sound Card Windows 98 DOS Gaming PT-2620-40 V3.0
326415597860.description:
I tested this card in Windows 98 / DOS. The DOS support was surprisingly good - didn't require EMM386 like some cards and was Sound Blaster compatible with all games I tested it with.

The only issue I had was that volume was low. On the output on the back it is labelled as Line Out / Output (or similar) and I have a feeling there's a software configuration that I missed to switch between the two. If you're going through decent amplified speakers, it shouldn't be an issue.

326415641395.title: Sapphire R9 280 Dual-X 3GB PCIE GPU with Boost UEFI, Upgraded Fans Fresh Paste
326415641395.description:
Despite being in very good condition when it came to me - the second fan was showing early signs of failure, which these cards are well known for. I removed the shroud and replaced the fans with two much higher quality fans from an EVGA card. These are thicker than the originals (which is why I had to remove the shroud) and have been attached directly to the heatsink.


The result is that it runs quieter than stock an temps are lower. Personally I like the aesthetic of the card without a shroud.


It's all been thoroughly cleaned, fresh thermal paste applied and fully tested.


-

325979566463.title: LEGO Brand Store Exclusive Build Trophy Minifigure Rare 6370079_39 6385428-1
325979566463.description:
I don't think these have an official set number - the number quoted is just what is written on the bag and I believe it's shared across multiple of these exclusive builds.

I'm afraid I don't know much about them - they are hard to find information on! According to re-brickable, these are 6385428-1 and were handed out in the Copenhagen LEGO Store, and also used at "make and take" events held in LEGO Brand Stores in Utrecht. Quite how they ended up in the UK is beyond me - but I'm guessing they were also used in an event here in around 2021 / 2022.

They are new, but they are resealable bags so there is no "sealed" aspect to them. There is no box and they will be sent like this, in a padded envelope. There might me some light marking to the bag caused by the bricks.

326350269032.title: Rexel 5.25" Floppy Holder with 14 Healthy 360K PC Formatted Floppy Disks
326350269032.description:
The case is in overall good condition and the keys work. The bottom part of the dividers have snapped off on most of them, so won't knotch into the base - but still work as a general divider. I'm not sure how many this is meant to hold - but I imagine at minimum 50.

The floppy disks, I hand cleaned and slow formatted using my Canon 48TPI drive. There may well be a mixed of 96 and 48 TPI discs here as there are varying brands - so depending on your drive, it might be prudent to reformat them - It was more of a way for me to test for bad sectors. 

I have put a new label on each disk, and removed any old labels. Some of them (such as the ATI Floppy) I've left as is, as you may want to put something ATI related back on them!

They are currently PC Formatted, but obviously you can reformat them for Mac/BBC etc. as long as they support these disks. They are all Double Sided, Double Density 360KB disks.

--

326212619041.title: Bestec ATX-300-12Z 300W Rev DCR ATX Power Supply HP P/N 5188-2627
326212619041.description:
- 5 Molex Connectors

 - 2 SATA Connectors

 - 24 Pin ATX Connector

 - P4 / 4-Pin Connector

 - 1 Floppy Connector
 - Tested and working!


Tested and Working!


I thoroughly test everything and I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. Items are cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away.


Need More?


I also have a large number of IDE/SATA cables (that I usually throw in free of charge!), hard drives, floppy drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


I am also happy to do custom builds and bundles depending on what you want!


Shipping


I almost always ship on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. The shipping price is not tied to a particular handler - I will choose the most appropriate, once it has been packaged and re-weighed.


My preference for shipping companies is Yodel or Royal Mail. If you need it by a particular date, please let me know in advance and I’ll try to accommodate.


I am happy to ship abroad - if you do not see an option for the Global Shipping Program, please contact me as sometimes eBay misses it off when I make a listing.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself, untouched and unless otherwise stated, you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. Do get in touch if there’s an angle you think I have missed, but bear in mind that vintage technology is likely to have general signs of wear and tear that isn’t always easy to capture!


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m  happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!

326212619039.description:

Napolean: Total War
Medieval II: Total War - PC DVD
Medieval II: Total War (Gold Edition) + Medieval II Total War Kingdoms (Expansion) - Unfortunately I snapped the first disk. However, I have provided a second copy of the Gold Edition Disk (as pictured), and I'm expecting that the expansion is on Disk 2 so it should all be fine. Serial number is under the disk on the case.

All my CDs and DVDs are tested and working, but may still have scuffs, minor scratches and other marks as expected with a used disc. If it has deep scratches, I do not sell it.


All photography is my own and you will get exactly what is seen. You are purchasing the physical item, not a license for software.


If a serial number is needed for installation, it is usually present on a sticker, in the manual or on the box. I do not check if they are needed, so in some cases they are missing. In most cases you can find a working serial number online.


Some games will use an online activation system such as Steam/Ubisoft/EA - I have no way to check if the serial numbers have been used before. I typically try to only sell vintage games that do not use such systems. Most of the older games that work this way, there are patches available online to get around it.


Check my feedback - I do everything I can to make sure everyone is happy, but there are simply limits to what I can check!


I dispatch the same day if ordered before ~2pm. I’m happy to combine postage and in many cases it does not affect the shipping cost, so do take a look at my other games as well as large collection of retro computer parts.

326462596924.title: Quantum BigFoot CY CY4320A 4.3GB 5.25" Hard Disk Drive IDE PATA Retro Vintage
326462596924.description:
Cosmetically in excellent condition. I formatted it and that added 3 bad sectors to the SMART data. After that, it was working exactly as expected. This is a "caution" in SMART (threshold is 20 bad sectors) which I still wouldn't usually sell, but this is such a seldom seen drive and a cool piece to show off, even if not used. I was very tempted just to hang it on my wall...

It's possible with a low-level format the bad sectors may disappear - but that's not something I wanted to do.

As it is, it's still very usable.

--

326247523321.title: Belkin Wireless G Notebook Card P5D7010 in Box with Drivers CardBus PCMCIA
326247523321.description:
Tested and Working!


I thoroughly test everything and I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. Items are cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away.


Need More?


I also have a large number of IDE/SATA cables (that I usually throw in free of charge!), hard drives, floppy drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


I am also happy to do custom builds and bundles depending on what you want!


Shipping


I almost always ship on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. The shipping price is not tied to a particular handler - I will choose the most appropriate, once it has been packaged and re-weighed.


My preference for shipping companies is Yodel or Royal Mail. If you need it by a particular date, please let me know in advance and I’ll try to accommodate.


I am happy to ship abroad - if you do not see an option for the Global Shipping Program, please contact me as sometimes eBay misses it off when I make a listing.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself, untouched and unless otherwise stated, you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. Do get in touch if there’s an angle you think I have missed, but bear in mind that vintage technology is likely to have general signs of wear and tear that isn’t always easy to capture!


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m  happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!

326464192787.title: Dell Optiplex 466 LN Socket 3 Motherboard Intel 486 DX2/66MHz 16MB HP-150SS PSU
326464192787.description:
I believe the system this was removed from was an Optiplex 466 LN. The BIOS shows "System 466 LN" or "L?" if the riser card is removed. 


The board itself is immaculate, with a brand new CMOS battery. Intel DX/2 66MHz CPU installed with 16MB of 72-Pin memory. There is no Level 2 cache, but I have a strong feeling that's how it came from the factory. Some obvious performance improvements could be had by adding some.


There is a single slot down the middle of the board, which the riser plugs into giving 3 x ISA slots. I have a strong suspicion though, that this is also a VESA Local Bus slot (VLB) but that is pure speculation on my part (my memories of VLB are vague) and I don't have any VLB cards to prove that point.


The board is obviously a custom shape, as the Optiplex chassis was quite bespoke. I'm sure it wouldn't be hard to fashion something to work.


The PSU is non-standard pinout (read: not ATX) and hard to come by, which is why I am including it. Externally there was some mild surface rust that brushed off leaving a smooth, but tarnished look. A little lacquer / clear nail varnish wouldn't hurt here, but I'll leave that to you.

Internally, I have cleaned the dust the best I can, including cleaning the fan and lubricating the bearings and checked for obvious signs of failure (none I could spot). I also set the fan to exhaust rather than intake to bring it more inline with later machines - easily reversed.


There is a Cirrus Logic video card integrated (CL-GD5429), but no sound. Grab yourself a Sound Blaster and you'd have an ideal DOS gaming setup.


I have run multiple tests and everything is working as intended (see photos). New CMOS battery installed.


--

326606870983.title: PCPartner VTech VP 486 SX 25MHz Motherboard 4MB 30-Pin, AT PSU, 128KB Cache DOS
326606870983.description:
This motherboard has an integrated 486 25MHz CPU, but there is a socket where you can install a DX CPU if desired. 128KB cache, tested. 4MB of 30-Pin memory (tested).


From what I understand, this is a standard AT PSU layout, but it's in one big block and I thought it would be easier to just bundle with the PSU. The PSU has been stripped, cleaned, fan bearings lubricated. The power switch had failed and has been replaced and now it works like new with all voltages stable. The switch I used was smaller - so I covered the little gap by gluing a small bit of plastic which also sits under the switch to keep it secure. Note the photos of the PSU internal is before I replaced the switch.


The onboard battery was holding charge, but I could see very very early signs of leaking at the top of the leg, so I removed it to prevent any trace damage. The holes are clear if you wanted to replace it with a new one, but as it also supports an external battery - I made one using a 3.7v lithium battery that can also be charged by USB-C if needed. The battery capacity is magnitudes higher than the original, so I don't imagine it'll ever need charging.


I'm always happy to include cables, but as the cables that came with this were very "of era" I've kept them together with the board - there is an IDE cable and a floppy drive cable.


I'm not sure what the standard/size the board is as I think it was likely custom for the chassis it was in (that was beyond recovery unfortunately). There is a riser card giving a total of 6 ISA slots.


I've included the front-panel connector block as the pinout isn't written on the board. As it fits in a single block, you can easily work out which pins do what.


--

Windows 98 does not support a drive greater than 137GB. You can still use larger drives for Windows 98 you just can't write to a partition after that point.

326561098353.title: 2x (Two) 1GB PC133 SDRAM CL3 Unbuffered 168-Pin TESTED PNY / Global Memory
326561098353.description:
Yes, you did that read that right - 1GB SDRAM modules. It goes without saying these are pretty rare - to the point I didn't even know they existed and assumed it was a mistake.

Not all boards/chipsets will support 1GB modules - in this instance I used a board with Intel 845 chipset and they were supported and ran the full suite of memtest tests without issues. There's a screenshot of the board too if you want those specifics.

According to CPU-Z, these are PNY modules, rebadged and sold under the "Global Memory" brand. 

I'm really not sure on the specific niche where these would come in handy - but the only ones I can think of, they only become useful as a pair. However, if you only just want one for your collection - I could consider splitting this into two lots - drop me a line if that's the case so I know if there is appetite.

326561284955.title: Toshiba 2140CDS/4.3 PS214E-98080 For Parts Socket 7 Laptop - See Description
326561284955.description:
When I got this machine, it turned on and worked perfectly - booted straight into Windows 98. Then after a few minutes, it froze and after that point wouldn't turn back on again. I suspect something is holding it in reset, as the correct 2.1V is getting to the CPU but it wasn't getting warm.

With a battery plugged in, it won't turn on at all as I found multiple shorted capacitors in the charging circuit - they are likely not shorted, but an indication of something else shorted. It's more than likely that this has caused the system wide failure, probably due to trying to charge a faulty/dead battery.

Without the battery plugged in, I just get a black screen.

I couldn't find anything obvious, but it was in far too nice of condition to simply get rid of and hopefully someone else with a similar machine can use it for parts.

I have kept (i.e will not be included): hard drive, floppy drive, RAM, optical, CPU, keyboard, battery as they could be useful to me. However, if you really need any of those - drop me a line, I might be able to include.

What we do know is that the display works perfectly and looked great (for a passive matrix screen) and the plastics are in top notch condition, including as you can see - the original sticker on the palm-rest.

All screws, heatsinks and the faulty motherboard, all included - I made sure I kept everything as I was dismantling it and they all went straight into bags along with the chassis. 

Shipping is a little awkward as I'll need to pack things separately.

Hopefully we can get this into the home of someone more skilled than me.

326669265684.description:
When I tested it, it powers up, detected and tried to read from the disk but failed. I opened it up to find the top head had fallen out of its housing. I glued it back it and then noticed that the bottom head has a piece of ceramic chipped off. Both of the heads are on flat ribbon cables so fairly trivial to switch over.


There may be other faults, but as this is a fairly rare drive - there may someone out there with working heads and a dead motor for example.


--

326942965550.title: Shogun: Total War PC (2000) Big Boxed - Manuals, 2 CDs & Official Strategy Guide
326942965550.description:
Manual and other printed materials look new. Strategy guide is an extra and shows some wear. CD jewel case seal was cut to inspect; discs have a couple of small marks but work fine.

Includes original retail box, printed manual, key command card / quick reference, 2 game discs (Disc 1 & Disc 2) and Prima's Official Strategy Guide (strategy guide shows wear).

System requirements (as printed on the box):

  • Minimum: Windows 95 or 98 (Windows NT and Windows 2000 are not supported); Intel Pentium 233MHz with MMX; 32MB free system RAM; 500MB hard drive space; 4x CD-ROM drive; 4MB DirectX 7.0a compatible video card.
  • Recommended: Intel Pentium 300MHz; 64MB free system RAM; 600MB hard drive space; 8x CD-ROM drive; 15MB Direct3D compatible 3D accelerator.
  • Multiplayer: 1 CD per PC. Network (2-8 players) via TCP/IP. Internet play (2-4 players) requires 33.6Kbps connection or faster.

326117181925.title: Gigabyte GV-RX55128D ATI Radeon X550 128MB Retro Gaming PCI-E Graphics Card
326117181925.description:
This is a fanless / passive / silent edition of the Radeon X550 graphics card. This is ideal for a Windows XP era retro build where noise is of concern but you still want some power!

Tested and Working!


I thoroughly test everything and I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. Items are cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away.


Need More?


I also have a large number of IDE/SATA cables (that I usually throw in free of charge!), hard drives, floppy drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


I am also happy to do custom builds and bundles depending on what you want!


Shipping


I almost always ship on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. The shipping price is not tied to a particular handler - I will choose the most appropriate, once it has been packaged and re-weighed.


My preference for shipping companies is Yodel or Royal Mail. If you need it by a particular date, please let me know in advance and I’ll try to accommodate.


I am happy to ship abroad - if you do not see an option for the Global Shipping Program, please contact me as sometimes eBay misses it off when I make a listing.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself, untouched and unless otherwise stated, you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. Do get in touch if there’s an angle you think I have missed, but bear in mind that vintage technology is likely to have general signs of wear and tear that isn’t always easy to capture!


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m  happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!

326330493506.title: 10Zig 58XX MFF 4GB RAM, Intel Atom D2550 @ 1.86GHz, 1GB Storage Expandable
326330493506.description:
This is a really cool bit of kit that I spent some time fiddling with, but didn't suit what I wanted to do with it. 


This is basically a SFF/MFF computer, but is advertised as a Thin Client - it's far more capable than that.


It's built on the Intel Atom D2550 CPU, running at 1.86GHz - notably, it's entirely passive. No fans = no noise. 


Originally it had 1GB of RAM, but I have upgraded it to 4GB (the picture of the memory is wrong, but I left it so you can see how easy it is to change and how much space there is internally).


The BIOS is surprising, supporting both EFI and Legacy boot. I was able to boot from USB very easily and the BIOS is unlocked (but has minimal options).


Internally there is a SATA 1GB flash module that clips on to a SATA port. You could also remove it and use the SATA port. Additionally there is a full SATA power with power that I've tried to show in the pictures. I removed the external casing from a SATA SSD and there was enough room to slide it in there - but not all SSDs are alike and some have larger PCBs, so beware of that.

I installed Windows XP without any issues, however, there are no XP drivers for 3D acceleration - only 2D. This would be fine if you just want something to run some DOS apps, but if you wanted to do 3D, you'll need to install Windows 7 or Linux. 


I think what this would be ideal for is a NAS box. I found even under load, it never used more than 7w of power, which is minimal. You could put a decent sized SSD in there and then a Linux install on the 1GB drive and you're golden.

The charger included is not the original, but exceeds the power requirements of the official charger. CMOS battery is good.


If you want something fun to have a fiddle with and see what you can do - this is it!

325919029998.description:
All my CDs and DVDs are tested and working, but may still have scuffs, minor scratches and other marks as expected with a used disc. If it has deep scratches, I do not sell it.


All photography is my own and you will get exactly what is seen. You are purchasing the physical item, not a license for software.


If a serial number is needed for installation, it is usually present on a sticker, in the manual or on the box. I do not check if they are needed, so in some cases they are missing. In most cases you can find a working serial number online.


Some games will use an online activation system such as Steam/Ubisoft/EA - I have no way to check if the serial numbers have been used before. I typically try to only sell vintage games that do not use such systems. Most of the older games that work this way, there are patches available online to get around it.


Check my feedback - I do everything I can to make sure everyone is happy, but there are simply limits to what I can check!


I dispatch the same day if ordered before ~2pm. I’m happy to combine postage and in many cases it does not affect the shipping cost, so do take a look at my other games as well as large collection of retro computer parts.

326262162038.description:
As far as I can tell this is new in box. I removed the pen to check it functions and then put it straight back in the case as I found it. 

The case itself, I'm not sure if it's just an unusual hinge arrangement, or if it's not working as it should - both parts can separate, but there also appear to be multiple slots for the hinge to go into depending on how you want it to sit (at least that's what I assume!).

But it's a wonderfully colourful looking pen and there are no marks or signs of damage that I can see. Dispatched same day.

I can't find this pen or similar anywhere, so I'm guessing it's pretty rare. Always open to an offer!

326262162080.title: ASUS P5S800-VM Pentium 4 640 3.2GHz 2GB DDR AGP 8x LGA775 Retro Motherboard
326262162080.description:
Tested and working - see CPU-Z screenshot for details. Clean, fresh thermal paste and working CMOS battery. Ideal for a Windows XP Retro Gaming rig. The onboard VGA connector was damaged, so I have cleanly removed it (see picture 9 to check my soldering!), but you would be mad not to put a decent AGP card in this anyway. The IO shield obviously has a space in it because of this - but could be covered with foil tape and will look fine.

This is technically the PS5800-VM/S - the S just denotes it was used for OEM, but it is identical as the retail board - so I have flashed the latest retail BIOS on there and it's working a treat. I can put the original OEM (Packard Bell) BIOS back on there if you prefer - the only real difference is that you get the ASUS logo upon boot instead of Packard Bell.

-

326331669986.title: Seagate Barracuda 7200.7 ST340014A 40GB / 32GB IDE PATA HDD Hard Disk Drive
326331669986.description:
Slow formatted to ensure no bad sectors, healthy SMART data - see the screenshot for details. You will receive the exact drive shown. Happy to include IDE cables.

Windows 98 does not support a drive greater than 137GB. You can still use larger drives for Windows 98 you just can't write to a partition after that point.

Software limitations aside, some older motherboards (typically 486 and older) also don't support drive capacities above usually 32GB, so some will have jumpers on them to reduce the capacity to make them compatible. This drive has that jumper.

-

326331683496.title: Western Digital Caviar WD400BB-00JHC0 40GB IDE PATA HDD Hard Disk Drive TESTED
326331683496.description:
Slow formatted to ensure no bad sectors, healthy SMART data - see the screenshot for details. You will receive the exact drive shown. Happy to include IDE cables.

Windows 98 does not support a drive greater than 137GB. You can still use larger drives for Windows 98 you just can't write to a partition after that point.

Software limitations aside, some older motherboards (typically 486 and older) also don't support drive capacities above usually 32GB, so some will have jumpers on them to reduce the capacity to make them compatible. I usually mention this in my listings if I see support for it.

326005084231.description:
NETGEAR RangeMax Wireless PCI Adapter WN311B 300Mbit N N300 No Antenna.

Tested and working in Windows XP. Even without antenna, it was good enough to work on my network! However, for the best performance, you will want to install antenna, not included.

Extras and Options


Do you need IDE/SATA cables? Would you prefer a different CPU, RAM configuration? Let me know. In many cases I’m happy to include/swap out free of charge.


I also have a large number of hard drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


Testing and Returns


All of my listings are thoroughly tested and I will do minor repairs if necessary. I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. That means, cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away, and in almost all cases - fresh thermal paste.


I don't have a strict return policy but should something fail within an unreasonable time period, I will always do my best to help fellow enthusiasts and I treat each situation on a case by case basis. So far, these situations have not come up due to the high level of testing I perform - just check my feedback. 


Shipping


I try my best to ship things on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. I try to avoid using Evri as they keep losing my packages.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself and unless stated, you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. If there is any significant damage/defect - I endeavor to highlight these, not hide them.


Pricing


I base my pricing on what things have sold for, and what they are currently selling for. However, as with all vintage technology - it’s only worth what people are willing to pay. I’m always open to any sensible offers, but please take into account the amount of time I spend testing, listing and shipping.


About


My hobby is helping keep vintage technology out of land-fill and back into the hands of like-minded hardware enthusiasts. A minimum of 10% of my sales goes to the animal rescue “Anim-mates” based in North Kent.


You can contact me on eBay, or I’m easy to find through most social media platforms, and happy to help where I can.

325805489363.title: PNY PC3200 512MB DDR 400 MHz Desktop Memory 184 Pins Fully Tested Packaged
325805489363.description:
Provided in the original packaging, they have passed a thorough memory test and and ready to use in your retro machine.

512MB is the perfect amount for a Windows 98, or an early XP build. If you have a Socket A (462) or Socket 478 (Pentium 4) era machine, this is likely the ram you are looking for.

If you aren't sure - send me a picture of your motherboard and I'm happy to help.

These came to me packaged, but I'm pretty sure they have been used in a machine and then put back into their original packaging later. I have personally tested them and they are good to go.

Tested and Working!


I thoroughly test everything and I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. Items are cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away.


Need More?


I also have a large number of IDE/SATA cables (that I usually throw in free of charge!), hard drives, floppy drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


I am also happy to do custom builds and bundles depending on what you want!


Shipping


I almost always ship on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. The shipping price is not tied to a particular handler - I will choose the most appropriate, once it has been packaged and re-weighed.


My preference for shipping companies is Yodel or Royal Mail. If you need it by a particular date, please let me know in advance and I’ll try to accommodate.


I am happy to ship abroad - if you do not see an option for the Global Shipping Program, please contact me as sometimes eBay misses it off when I make a listing.


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m  happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!

326374999158.title: Dell Inspiron 1200 for Windows XP Retro Gaming 30GB HDD 512MB 1.3GHz Pentium M
326374999158.description:
Internally and externally cleaned. Healthy 30GB hard drive, working DVD drive. 1.3GHz Pentium M with 512MB (tested, see photos).


I have done a clean install of Windows XP Professional and pre-installed Quake 1, 2, 3, Age of Empires and Dune 2000. With 70fps in Quake 3 at 1024x768, the integrated Intel graphics are still quite capable. If you have a particular game you want to play, let me know and I can test it in advance so there are no concerns around performance.


The display is 1024x768 and there is a bit of a yellow shade to the colours in the bottom half - it's very gradual and personally, I quite like the effect as it's minimal.


There is a brand new power supply included, but the battery does not seem to hold charge. Overall it's in good cosmetic condition with the usual external marks and scratches expected of something of this age. Any questions, I'm here to help!

Nero Tools is a rough guide to optical drive functionality. Always look up the model with the manufacturer if you have specific requirements.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself and you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. If there is any significant damage/defect - I endeavor to highlight this, not hide it. Do get in touch if there’s an angle you think I have missed, but bear in mind that vintage technology is likely to have general signs of wear and tear that isn’t always easy to capture!


Pricing


I base my pricing on what things have sold for, and what they are currently selling for. However, as with all vintage technology - it’s only worth what people are willing to pay. I’m always open to any sensible offers, but please take into account the amount of time I spend testing, listing and shipping.


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!

325736131536.title: USB Male to 2 x PS2 Female Ports - Use Retro Mouse Keyboard on Modern PC
325736131536.description:
This is to allow you to plug in a PS/2 keyboard and/or mouse into a computer that has USB. Unlike the passive convertors that require the device to support USB natively, this essentially simulates native PS/2 ports, so any normal PS/2 device can plug into it.

Tested and Working!


I thoroughly test everything and I would never sell something I would not be happy to use myself. That means no bulging capacitors, noisy fans, or temporary “reflow” fixes. Items are cleaned to a state that is good enough to be used straight away.


Need More?


I also have a large number of IDE/SATA cables (that I usually throw in free of charge!), hard drives, floppy drives, optical drives, power supplies, cases (most of which aren’t listed) so drop me a line with what you need and I can set up a listing for you so you still get eBay purchase protection. I also encourage you to look at my other listings.


I am also happy to do custom builds and bundles depending on what you want!


Shipping


I almost always ship on the day of purchase. Sensitive electronic components will always be delivered in an anti-static bag in addition to any packing material to ensure its physical safety. The shipping price is not tied to a particular handler - I will choose the most appropriate, once it has been packaged and re-weighed.


My preference for shipping companies is Yodel or Royal Mail. If you need it by a particular date, please let me know in advance and I’ll try to accommodate.


I am happy to ship abroad - if you do not see an option for the Global Shipping Program, please contact me as sometimes eBay misses it off when I make a listing.


Photography


All photography is taken by myself, untouched and unless otherwise stated, you will receive exactly what is shown in the photos. Do get in touch if there’s an angle you think I have missed, but bear in mind that vintage technology is likely to have general signs of wear and tear that isn’t always easy to capture!


Questions?


Feel free to get in touch about anything - I’m  happy to offer help where I can. Picking the right products can be a little daunting!
